@susanmgaines I don’t disagree… but I’m glad to be putting my effort into this one. 
😷❤️😷📚

@CaroltheCrone @pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes Because 1) We need to process the experience first, and it's hard to do that while still in it. 2) Few writers can write a (good) novel in <2 years, add a year for production. More common is 4-5 years, likewise for movie production.
@CaroltheCrone @pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes Writers are grappling with this, unsure of how to address it.

@pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes @carol_weston I have not understood why the arts have not reflected our experiences in this pandemic. It’s not over even now, and many of us are forever changed, yet books, movies, vids, games…all show life as it was in 2019. I don’t get it.
@ackerman_rob @pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes Help us if u can please !😰😰
@ackerman_rob @carol_weston @nytimes .You can add WISH YOU WERE HERE by @jodipicoult .

@pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes Already read and loved Rachel Cusk’s The Second Place, Gary Shteyngart’s Our Country Friends, and Carol Weston’s Hidden Lake, and look forward to Isabel Allende’s novel and other good stories well told.

@pkhorn @carol_weston @nytimes I agree!  Covid has changed so many lives, and it will eventually infiltrate literature - it may take a few years to get there, like the 9-11 books that have come out in recent years.
